title: Property Tax Explainer
text:
Introduction
Cook County relies on property taxes to serve its residents. Find out how your property tax is calculated by reading our guide.
The Cook County Assessor’s Office, the State, and county taxing districts (schools, parks, etc.) work together to calculate fair property taxes for residents.
Let’s talk a more thorough look at this outline below.

title: Property Tax Explainer
text:
How do property taxes work?


Let’s take a look at a property tax bill.
This is confusing. Let’s zoom out and explain what this all means and how we calculate these numbers.
First, let’s take a look at tax rates…

title: Property Tax Explainer
section: How do we calculate tax rate?
text:
How do we calculate tax rate?
We take a look at the County Of Cook (as colored in purple)





We zoom in to show the taxing district of the County Of Cook
Each year, this taxing district sets a levy . This is the amount it needs to collect that year in order to provide services. (This was $780.0M in 2021.)
Let’s zoom in even further. If you are a property owner in County Of Cook of a home worth $55K, your taxable value (EAV) is $160K.


Zoom: 14





The total taxable value of all properties in County Of Cook make up its tax base (County Of Cook’s tax base is $180B )
To divide the cost of services among all property owners, County Of Cook sets its local tax rate equal to: \(\mathrm{{Levy \over Base} = Tax \hspace{0.1cm} rate}\)


Zoom: 14





Using real numbers, the tax rate equals: \(\mathrm{{5.9M \over 320M} = 1.84%}\)

title: Property Tax Explainer
text:
The mission of the Cook County Assessor’s Office is to deliver accurate and transparent assessments of all residential and commercial properties. We serve every community in the County through ethical stewardship within the property tax system. We will achieve our mission through:


High-quality data is essential for fair and equitable assessments. The CCAO is dedicated to excellence and agility in the collection, management, and sharing of data to inform our decisions and mirror the market.



The CCAO is committed to enhancing our employees’ skills through modern tools, techniques and training. This fosters an environment of collaboration and produces the leadership necessary to tackle new opportunities.



At the CCAO, our aim is to deliver high-caliber services, provide clear and accurate information, and seek feedback to improve our work so we can support the economic vitality of Cook County.






Deliver accurate and uniform assessments, with timely and informative notices, in compliance with industry standards and guided by best practices.



Build transparency into every part of the office—making services more effective and efficient—and earn the public’s trust.



Create an office culture of professionalism, inclusion and public accountability, with engaged employees who take pride in the delivery of high-quality, accessible services for all. (Read our Office’s ethics code.)

title: Property Tax Explainer
text:
What are property taxes?
Property tax is a tax assessed on real estate by a government authority, typically based on the value of the property. The tax is used to fund public services such as schools, roads, and emergency services in the local area.
Property owners must pay this tax annually, regardless of whether they own a residential or commercial property.
